Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Fund \Fund\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Funded}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Funding}.] 1. To provide and appropriate a fund or permanent revenue for the payment of the interest of; to make permanent provision of resources (as by a pledge of revenue from customs) for discharging the interest of or principal of; as, to fund government notes. [1913 Webster]
2. To place in a fund, as money. [1913 Webster]
3. To put into the form of bonds or stocks bearing regular interest; as, to fund the floating debt. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Funding \Fund"ing\, a. 1. Providing a fund for the payment of the interest or principal of a debt. [1913 Webster]
2. Investing in the public funds. [1913 Webster]
{Funding system}, a system or scheme of finance or revenue by which provision is made for paying the interest or principal of a public debt. [1913 Webster]

funding n 1: financial resources provided to make some project possible; "the foundation provided support for the experiment" [syn: {support}, {financial support}, {backing}, {financial backing}] 2: the act of financing [syn: {financing}]
